Sentencas: Designing heterogeneous electrolytes with superior interface charge transfer is promising for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs).
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, a rational construction with optimal interfaces to maximize ionic conduction remains a challenge.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here an in situ phase-transformation strategy is demonstrated to prepare a highly conductive heterogeneous electrolyte.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A pristine LiNiO2-TiO2 nanocomposite precursor undergoes chemical reactions and phase-transformation upon heating and feeding H-2, destroying the original phases, and forming new species, including an amorphous Li2CO3 scaffold within a (Ni, Co, Al, and Ti)-oxide (NCAT) matrix.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It creates an intertwining and continuous network inside the electrolyte with plentiful interfaces.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The in situ formed NCAT/Li2CO3 heterogeneous electrolyte displays superior ionic conductivity and impressive fuel cell performance.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This work emphasizes the potential of rational heterogeneous structure design and interface engineering for LT-SOFC electrolyte through an in situ phase-transform approach.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The generated interfaces enhance ion transport, presenting an opportunity for further optimizing electrolyte candidates, and lowering the operating temperatures of SOFCs.
Titulo: In Situ Phase-Transformation Forming a Bicontinuous (Ni, Co, Ti, and Al)-Oxide/Li2CO3 Interpenetrating Network Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
